page.title: 12WINDY NOOK: SETTLEMENT
page.content: Windy Nook is part of Felling and stands on top of a steep hill. On a clear day the view from our school is impressive. Ahead of us is the twisting course of the River Tyne. To the North are the Simonside and Cheviot Hills and to the East is the North Sea. The nearest sea-side resort is South Shields. As Windy Nook stands on the top of a hill it is in an exposed area, and on a windy day it is obvious how it was given its name. Although our school is one hundred and two years old, the houses surrounding it are modern brick built ones. However, some of the houses, in the area are about the same age as our school. The houses are built of sandstone which probably came from the Felling quarries. One of these quarries is very close to our school, but has now been filled in.
